Proof: <script>alert('xss')</script> was reflected in the response body.
Plugin Output: The parameter searchQuery is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. Input was reflected without encoding in the HTML response body.
Description: A reflected cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in the searchQuery parameter of the /search endpoint on the payment service. An attacker could inject malicious scripts that execute in the context of the victim's browser session.
Steps to Remediate: Sanitize all user input and encode output. Implement Content-Security-Policy headers. Use framework-provided output encoding functions.

Proof: SQL error: You have an error in your SQL syntax near ''1 OR 1=1--'
Plugin Output: The parameter accountId is vulnerable to SQL injection. The application returned a database error when a crafted payload was submitted.
Description: A SQL injection vulnerability exists in the accountId parameter of the /api/account/lookup endpoint. An attacker could execute arbitrary SQL queries against the backend database, potentially extracting sensitive financial data or modifying account records.
Steps to Remediate: Use parameterized queries or prepared statements. Never concatenate user input into SQL queries. Apply input validation using allowlists.

Proof: Response contained output of 'id' command: uid=1001(appuser) gid=1001(appuser)
Plugin Output: The parameter cmd is vulnerable to OS command injection. The application executed an injected system command and returned its output.
Description: An OS command injection vulnerability was detected in the cmd parameter of the /admin/diagnostic endpoint on the user portal. An attacker could execute arbitrary operating system commands on the underlying server.
Steps to Remediate: Never pass user input directly to system commands. Use allowlists for permitted operations. Implement proper input validation and shell escaping.

Proof: Server negotiated TLSv1.1 which is considered weak.
Plugin Output: The server supports TLSv1.1 which is deprecated and considered insecure. Modern browsers and security standards require TLSv1.2 or higher.
Description: The web server at sAPP03.prod.bank.example.com supports deprecated TLS protocol versions (TLSv1.1). This could allow an attacker to exploit known weaknesses in older protocol versions to intercept or modify encrypted communications.
Steps to Remediate: Disable TLSv1.0 and TLSv1.1. Configure the server to only support TLSv1.2 and TLSv1.3 with strong cipher suites.
